channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Uneven slab, trip hazard, 6th December
item.description:
This slab is lifted and cracked and has a depth of at least 25mm. It is next to the wall of 6 Fairlawn Avenue. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairlawn Avenue, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wrecked Vehicle on road, 6th December
item.description:
This vehicles has been left on the road and part on pavement for a while now. The owner has managed to re-tax it because it doesn't need an MOT as it is over 40 yrs old. Yet the rules indicate that it can only be retaxed, without an MOT if it is kept roadworthy. It is far from roadworthy. It is a wreck. An eyesore.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Limewood Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep potholes at manhole covers - sharp edges, 6th December
item.description:

item.title: Scaffolding blocking road, 6th December
item.description:
This is a one way road and there are no warnings or signs suggesting road closure. scaffolding is being put up and the entire road is blocked halfway down, only visible after turning onto road. absolutely no effort to warn road users, assume this is an unofficial and unauthorised road closure
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 158, Lewisham Way, New Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opened packaging on verge outside 1 Lawn Rd, 6th December
item.description:
